cpsc2150.extendedOthello.models

Interface IOthelloBoard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbsOthelloBoard, OthelloBoard

    public interface IOthelloBoard
    IOthelloBoard interface defines the public behaviors required for an Othello board implementation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkPlayerWin(char player)
      Checks if the given player has won the game (i.e., has more tokens when the board is full).
      void flipDiagDirections(BoardPosition startingPos)
      Flips tokens diagonally in all four diagonal directions.
      void flipHoriDirections(BoardPosition startingPos)
      Flips tokens horizontally (left and right) starting from the placed token.
      void flipVertDirections(BoardPosition startingPos)
      Flips tokens vertically (up and down) starting from the placed token.
      void forcePlace(char p, BoardPosition pos)
      Forcefully places a token at a position without flipping any tokens (used for setup/testing).
      char[][] getBoardCopy()
      Returns a deep copy of the current game board.
      int[] getScore()
      Gets the current score of the game.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Integer> getScores()
      Gets the scores of the game as a HashMap.
      boolean isPlayerAtPos(BoardPosition pos, char player)
      Checks if a player occupies the specified board position.
      boolean isPositionValid(BoardPosition pos)
      Checks if a position on the board is empty and valid to place a token.
      void placeToken(char p, BoardPosition pos)
      Places a player's token at the specified position and flips the opponent's tokens accordingly.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Provides a string representation of the board and score.
      char whatsAtPos(BoardPosition pos)
      Returns the character at a given position on the board.

    • Method Detail

      • placeToken

        void placeToken(char p,
                BoardPosition pos)
        Places a player's token at the specified position and flips the opponent's tokens accordingly.
        Parameters:
        p - the player token ('X' or 'O')
        pos - the position to place the token

      • whatsAtPos

        char whatsAtPos(BoardPosition pos)
        Returns the character at a given position on the board.
        Parameters:
        pos - The board position to check.
        Returns:
        The character at that position ('X', 'O', or ' ')

      • flipVertDirections

        void flipVertDirections(BoardPosition startingPos)
        Flips tokens vertically (up and down) starting from the placed token.
        Parameters:
        startingPos - the newly placed token's position

      • flipHoriDirections

        void flipHoriDirections(BoardPosition startingPos)
        Flips tokens horizontally (left and right) starting from the placed token.
        Parameters:
        startingPos - the newly placed token's position

      • flipDiagDirections

        void flipDiagDirections(BoardPosition startingPos)
        Flips tokens diagonally in all four diagonal directions.
        Parameters:
        startingPos - the newly placed token's position

      • isPositionValid

        boolean isPositionValid(BoardPosition pos)
        Checks if a position on the board is empty and valid to place a token.
        Parameters:
        pos - the board position to check
        Returns:
        true if the position is within bounds and unoccupied

      • isPlayerAtPos

        boolean isPlayerAtPos(BoardPosition pos,
                      char player)
        Checks if a player occupies the specified board position.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position to check
        player - the player token ('X' or 'O')
        Returns:
        true if the specified player occupies that position

      • checkPlayerWin

        boolean checkPlayerWin(char player)
        Checks if the given player has won the game (i.e., has more tokens when the board is full).
        Parameters:
        player - the player token to check for victory
        Returns:
        true if the player has the majority of tokens at game end

      • getScore

        int[] getScore()
        Gets the current score of the game.
        Returns:
        An int array where index 0 is score of X and index 1 is score of O

      • forcePlace

        void forcePlace(char p,
                BoardPosition pos)
        Forcefully places a token at a position without flipping any tokens (used for setup/testing).
        Parameters:
        p - the player token ('X' or 'O')
        pos - the position to place the token

      • getBoardCopy

        char[][] getBoardCopy()
        Returns a deep copy of the current game board.
        Returns:
        a 2D character array copy of the board

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Provides a string representation of the board and score.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A visual string of the game board including player scores

      • getScores

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Integer> getScores()
        Gets the scores of the game as a HashMap.
        Returns:
        A HashMap containing 'X' and 'O' as keys, with their respective scores as values
